title: Say Hello
does: Emits a greeting and prints the program and caller identities.
why: Introduces the Solana program entrypoint pattern and shows how accounts are accessed for logging and debugging.
breaksIfRemoved: The program no longer has a runnable instruction, so clients cannot invoke it to verify deployment.
securityImplications: Low risk on its own, but removing logs reduces observability when diagnosing account or authority issues.
